pullRequest.body:
The canonical bilinear form for a root pairing over a linearly ordered commutative ring is nondegenerate when restricted to the span of roots.

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Very nice!

I've just done a first pass. However I can't help wondering if you really need to be working with both `Module.rank` and `Module.finrank`. Would it be possible to avoid `Module.rank` and just use `Module.finrank` throughout?

Very nice!

I've just done a first pass. However I can't help wondering if you really need to be working with both `Module.rank` and `Module.finrank`. Would it be possible to avoid `Module.rank` and just use `Module.finrank` throughout?

I couldn't resist a little golf:
```suggestion
  let g : M →ₗ[R] M :=
    { toFun := fun x ↦ r • x
      map_add' := by simp
      map_smul' := fun s x ↦ by simp [← smul_assoc, IsMulCentral.comm hrc s] }
  exact (g.restrict h).rank_le_of_injective <| fun _ _ h ↦ by simpa using hr (Subtype.ext_iff.mp h)
```
Possibly what is called `g` here should be extracted to a definition in its own right.

I note we already have [LinearMap.lsmul](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/BilinearMap.html#LinearMap.lsmul) but that requires `CommRing` because it is also linear in `R`.
This should be moved. I think possibly `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.BigOperators.Ring.Finset` might be a good home.

```suggestion
  [Module R N] (P : RootPairing ι R M N)
```

```suggestion
  simp
```

```suggestion
  simp
```

```suggestion
  obtain ⟨c, hc⟩ : P.RootForm (P.root i) (P.root i) ∣ ∏ a : ι, P.RootForm (P.root a) (P.root a) :=
```
and then drop `obtain ⟨c, hc⟩ := hdvd` below

```suggestion
lemma prod_rootForm_smul_coroot_mem_range_domRestrict (i : ι) :
```

How about we add:
```lean
open Set
open Submodule (span)
```
at the top of the file and then we can write this as:
```suggestion
    LinearMap.range (P.Polarization.domRestrict (span R (range P.root))) ≤
```

Or maybe even introduce:
```lean
abbrev rootSpan := span R (range P.root)
abbrev corootSpan := span R (range P.coroot)
```
over in `RootSystem.Defs`?

```suggestion
      LinearMap.range (P.Polarization.domRestrict (span R (range P.root))) := by
```

```suggestion
# Nondegeneracy of the polarization on a finite root pairing

We show that if the base ring of a finite root pairing is linearly ordered, then the canonical
```

```suggestion
Weyl group.

## Main results:
```

```suggestion
  non-positive norm.

## References:
```

```suggestion
 * Bourbaki, Lie groups and Lie algebras

## Todo
```

```suggestion
  [Module R N] (P : RootPairing ι R M N)
```

We need to fully qualify names to make our docs links work
```suggestion
 * `RootPairing.rootForm_rootPositive`: `RootForm` is root-positive.
```
(likewise the two below)

You can proceed with:
```suggestion
  have := P.polarization_domRestrict_kernel_rank_zero
  rwa [Submodule.rank_eq_zero] at this
```
However I think it would be better to proceed as:
```lean
  rw [LinearMap.ker_domRestrict, ← Submodule.disjoint_iff_comap_eq_bot]
```
and restate `polarization_domRestrict_kernel_rank_zero` as suggested below.

I usually state everything lattice theoretically when I can because we have such good coverage. So how about instead:
```suggestion
lemma disjoint_rootSpan_ker_polarization :
    Disjoint (span R (range P.root)) (LinearMap.ker P.Polarization) := by
```

pullRequest.title: feat (LinearAlgebra/RootSystem/Finite): nondegeneracy of canonical bilinear form restricted to root span
